io.github.rowak.nanoleafapi

Class NanoleafDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.rowak.nanoleafapi.NanoleafDevice
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Aurora, Canvas, Shapes

    public abstract class NanoleafDevice
extends java.lang.Object
    The primary class in the API. Contains methods and other classes for accessing and manipulating a Nanoleaf device.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String API_LEVEL
      The API level for interfacing with the Open API (the latest version is v1)
      static int DEFAULT_PORT
      The default port used by all Nanoleaf devices
      static int EXTERNAL_STREAMING_PORT
      The port for external streaming v2

    • Method Detail

      • createDevice

        public static final NanoleafDevice createDevice(java.lang.String hostname,
                                                int port,
                                                java.lang.String accessToken)
                                         throws NanoleafException,
                                                java.io.IOException
        A generic creation method for instantiating a NanoleafDevice object, without requiring prior knowledge of the device *type*.
        Parameters:
        hostname - the hostname of the controller
        port - the port of the controller (default=16021)
        accessToken - a unique authentication token
        Returns:
        a new Nanoleaf device
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • createDeviceAsync

        public static final void createDeviceAsync(java.lang.String hostname,
                                           int port,
                                           java.lang.String accessToken,
                                           NanoleafCallback<NanoleafDevice> callback)
                                    throws NanoleafException,
                                           java.io.IOException
        An asynchronous and generic creation method for instantiating a NanoleafDevice object, without requiring prior knowledge of the device *type*.
        Parameters:
        hostname - the hostname of the controller
        port - the port of the controller (default=16021)
        accessToken - a unique authentication token
        callback - the callback that is called when the device has been initialized
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • closeAsync

        public void closeAsync()

        Force a shutdown of the internal HTTP client.

        Note: This method only has effect if asynchronous calls have been made. The HTTP client will eventually shut down on its own, but the application will likely hang until it does (unless this method is called).

      • closeEventListener

        public void closeEventListener()
        Closes all event listeners that have been opened with NanoleafDevice#registerTouchEventListener.

      • getHostname

        public java.lang.String getHostname()
        Returns the device's hostname.
        Returns:
        the hostname for this device

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns the port that the device is listening on.
        Returns:
        the port for this device

      • getAccessToken

        public java.lang.String getAccessToken()
        Returns the access token that was used to initialize the device object.
        Returns:
        the access token for this device

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()

        Returns the unique name of the device controller.

        Note that this method does not communicate with the device, since the name is retrieved at creation time and is almost always unwritable.

        Returns:
        the name of the device controller

      • getSerialNumber

        public java.lang.String getSerialNumber()

        Returns the unique serial number of the device.

        Note that this method does not communicate with the device, since the serial number is retrieved at creation time and is almost always unwritable.

        Returns:
        the serial number of the device

      • getManufacturer

        public java.lang.String getManufacturer()

        Returns the name of the manufacturer of the device.

        Note that this method does not communicate with the device, since the manufacturer name is retrieved at creation time and is almost always unwritable.

        Returns:
        the name of the device manufacturer

      • getFirmwareVersion

        public java.lang.String getFirmwareVersion()
                                    throws NanoleafException,
                                           java.io.IOException
        Returns the firmware version of the device.
        Returns:
        the firmware version
        Throws:
        NanoleafException
        java.io.IOException

      • getFirmwareVersionAsync

        public void getFirmwareVersionAsync(NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously gets the firmware version of the device.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        callback - returns the firmware version

      • getModel

        public java.lang.String getModel()

        Returns the model of the device.

        Note that this method does not communicate with the device, since the model number is retrieved at creation time and is almost always unwritable.

        Returns:
        the model of the device

      • identify

        public void identify()
              throws NanoleafException,
                     java.io.IOException
        Causes the panels to flash in unison. This is typically used to help users differentiate between multiple panels.
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • identifyAsync

        public void identifyAsync(NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously causes the panels to flash in unison. This is typically used to help users differentiate between multiple panels.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        callback - called when the identify animation begins or when an error occurs

      • getOn

        public boolean getOn()
              throws NanoleafException,
                     java.io.IOException
        Gets the on state of the device (true = on, false = off).
        Returns:
        true, if the device is on
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • getOnAsync

        public void getOnAsync(NanoleafCallback<java.lang.Boolean> callback)

        Asynchronously gets the on state of the device (true = on, false = off).

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        callback - returns the on state

      • setOn

        public void setOn(boolean on)
           throws NanoleafException,
                  java.io.IOException
        Sets the on state of the device (true = on, false = off).
        Parameters:
        on - whether the device should be turned on or off
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • setOnAsync

        public void setOnAsync(boolean on,
                       NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously sets the on state of the device (true = on, false = off).

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        on - whether the device should be turned on or off
        callback - called when the device changes power state or when an error occurs

      • toggleOn

        public boolean toggleOn()
                 throws NanoleafException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Toggles the on state of the device (on = off, off = on).
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • toggleOnAsync

        public void toggleOnAsync(NanoleafCallback<java.lang.Boolean> callback)
                   throws NanoleafException,
                          java.io.IOException

        Toggles the on state of the device (on = off, off = on).

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        callback - called when the the device changes power state or if error occurs
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • fadeToBrightness

        public void fadeToBrightness(int brightness,
                             int duration)
                      throws NanoleafException,
                             java.io.IOException

        Fades the master brightness of the device over a period of time.

        Note: the fade itself is not synchronous, only the request being made. This means that the calling thread will not hang during the fade.

        Parameters:
        brightness - the new brightness level as a percent
        duration - the fade time, in seconds
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid, or the specified brightness is not between 0 and 100 (inclusive)
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • fadeToBrightnessAsync

        public void fadeToBrightnessAsync(int brightness,
                                  int duration,
                                  NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously fades the master brightness of the device over a period of time.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        brightness - the new brightness level as a percent
        duration - the fade time, in seconds
        callback - called when the fade begins or when an error occurs

                           NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid, or NanoleafCallback.NOT_FOUND if the effect does not exist.         java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • getEffectAsync

        public void getEffectAsync(java.lang.String effectName,
                           NanoleafCallback<Effect> callback)

        Asynchronously gets the effect currently being displayed on the device.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid, or NanoleafCallback.NOT_FOUND if the effect does not exist. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE. The returned data will never be meaningful (either an empty string or null).

        Parameters:
        effectName - the name of the effect
        callback - returns the effect

      • setPanelColor

        public void setPanelColor(Panel panel,
                          int red,
                          int green,
                          int blue,
                          int transitionTime)
                   throws NanoleafException,
                          java.io.IOException
        Sets the color of a single panel on the device.
        Parameters:
        panel - the target panel
        red - the red RGB value
        green - the green RGB value
        blue - the blue RGB value
        transitionTime - the time to transition to this frame from the previous frame (must be 1 or greater)
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid, or the specified panel does not exist, or the RGB values are invalid (must be 0 < x < 255)
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • setPanelColorAsync

        public void setPanelColorAsync(Panel panel,
                               int red,
                               int green,
                               int blue,
                               int transitionTime,
                               NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously sets the color of a single panel on the device.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid, or NanoleafCallback.UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY/NanoleafCallback.BAD_REQUEST if the color is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE. The returned data will never be meaningful (either an empty string or null).

        Parameters:
        panel - the target panel
        red - the red RGB value
        green - the green RGB value
        blue - the blue RGB value
        transitionTime - the time to transition to this frame from the previous frame (must be 1 or greater)
        callback - called when the panel changes color or when an error occurs

      • fadeToColor

        public void fadeToColor(int red,
                        int green,
                        int blue,
                        int duration)
                 throws NanoleafException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Fades all of the panels to an RGB color over a period of time.
        Parameters:
        red - the red RGB value
        green - the green RGB value
        blue - the blue RGB value
        duration - the fade time, in hertz (10Hz = 1sec)
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid, or the RGB values are invalid (must be 0 < x < 255), or the duration is negative
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • fadeToColorAsync

        public void fadeToColorAsync(int red,
                             int green,
                             int blue,
                             int duration,
                             NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously fades all of the panels to an RGB color over a period of time.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid, or NanoleafCallback.UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY/NanoleafCallback.BAD_REQUEST if the color/duration are invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE. The returned data will never be meaningful (either an empty string or null).

        Parameters:
        red - the red RGB value
        green - the green RGB value
        blue - the blue RGB value
        duration - the fade time, in hertz (10Hz = 1sec)
        callback - called when the fade starts or when an error occurs

      • writeEffect

        public java.lang.String writeEffect(java.lang.String command)
                             throws NanoleafException,
                                    java.io.IOException

        (This method works with JSON data)

        Uploads a JSON string to the device. Calls the write effect command from the OpenAPI. Refer to it for more information about the commands.

        Commands:

        • add - Installs an effect on the device or updates the effect if it already exists.
        • delete - Permanently removes an effect from the device.
        • request - Requests a single effect by name.
        • requestAll - Requests all the installed effects from the device.
        • display - Sets a color mode on the device (used for previewing effects).
        • displayTemp - Temporarily sets a color mode on the device (typically used for notifications of visual indicators).
        • rename - Changes the name of an effect on the device.
        Parameters:
        command - the operation to perform the write with
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid, or the command parameter is invalid JSON, or the command parameter contains an invalid command or has invalid command options
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • writeEffectAsync

        public void writeEffectAsync(java.lang.String command,
                             NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        (This method works with JSON data)

        Asynchronously uploads a JSON string to the device. Calls the write effect command from the OpenAPI. Refer to it for more information about the commands.

        Commands:

        • add - Installs an effect on the device or updates the effect if it already exists.
        • delete - Permanently removes an effect from the device.
        • request - Requests a single effect by name.
        • requestAll - Requests all the installed effects from the device.
        • display - Sets a color mode on the device (used for previewing effects).
        • displayTemp - Temporarily sets a color mode on the device (typically used for notifications of visual indicators).
        • rename - Changes the name of an effect on the device.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid, or NanoleafCallback.UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY/NanoleafCallback.BAD_REQUEST if the effect is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE. The returned data will never be meaningful (either an empty string or null).

        Parameters:
        command - the operation to perform the write with
        callback - called when the write request completes or when an error occurs

      • getPanels

        public java.util.List<Panel> getPanels()
                                throws NanoleafException,
                                       java.io.IOException

        Gets an array of the connected panels.

        This is the ORIGINAL location data. Since the original location data is not affected by the global orientation, this data may not accurately represent the panels if displayed as is. For rotated panel data, use the getPanelsRotated() method instead.

        Returns:
        an array of panels
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • getPanelsAsync

        This is the ORIGINAL location data. Since the original location data is not affected by the global orientation, this data may not accurately represent the panels if displayed as is. For rotated panel data, use the getPanelsRotated() method instead.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        callback - returns the array of panels

        callback - called when external streaming is enabled or when an error occurs

      • sendStaticEffectExternalStreaming

        public void sendStaticEffectExternalStreaming(StaticEffect effect)
                                       throws NanoleafException,
                                              java.io.IOException

        Sends a series of frames to the target Aurora.

        Note:Requires external streaming to be enabled. Enable it using the enableExternalStreaming() method.

        Parameters:
        effect - the custom effect to be sent to the Aurora
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O exception occurs
        java.net.SocketException - If the target device cannot be found or connected to

      • sendStaticEffectExternalStreamingAsync

        public void sendStaticEffectExternalStreamingAsync(StaticEffect effect,
                                                   NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously sends a series of frames to the target Aurora.

        Note:Requires external streaming to be enabled. Enable it using the enableExternalStreaming() method.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        effect - the custom effect to be sent to the Aurora
        callback - called when the effect is sent or when an error occurs

      • sendAnimData

        public void sendAnimData(java.lang.String animData)
                  throws NanoleafException,
                         java.io.IOException

        Sends a static animation data string to the target device.

        Note:Requires external streaming to be enabled. Enable it using the enableExternalStreaming() method.

        Parameters:
        animData - the static animation data to be sent to the device
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O exception occurs
        java.net.SocketException - If the target device cannot be found or connected to

      • setPanelExternalStreaming

        public void setPanelExternalStreaming(int panelId,
                                      int red,
                                      int green,
                                      int blue,
                                      int transitionTime)
                               throws NanoleafException,
                                      java.io.IOException
        Updates the color of a single panel.
        Parameters:
        panelId - the id of the panel to update
        red - the red RGB value
        green - the green RGB value
        blue - the blue RGB value
        transitionTime - the time to transition to this frame from the previous frame (must be 1 or greater)
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O exception occurs
        java.net.SocketException - If the target device cannot be found or connected to

      • setPanelExternalStreamingAsync

        public void setPanelExternalStreamingAsync(int panelId,
                                           int red,
                                           int green,
                                           int blue,
                                           int transitionTime,
                                           NanoleafCallback<java.lang.String> callback)

        Asynchronously updates the color of a single panel.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        panelId - the id of the panel to update
        red - the red RGB value
        green - the green RGB value
        blue - the blue RGB value
        transitionTime - the time to transition to this frame from the previous frame (must be 1 or greater)
        callback - called when the panel color changes or when an error occurs
